text:
“Good heavens!” Pulcheria Alexandrovna exclaimed. Razumihin couldn’t sit still, fidgeting in his chair.

“Aren’t you ashamed, sister?” Raskolnikov asked.

“I am ashamed, Rodya,” Dounia replied, her face pale with anger. “Pyotr Petrovitch, leave now.”

Pyotr Petrovitch looked shocked. He was way too confident in himself and thought he had everyone under his control. Now, he was pale and his lips trembled.

“Avdotya Romanovna, if I walk out that door after this, I won’t come back. Think about what you’re doing. My word is solid.”

“What insolence!” Dounia shot back, jumping up from her seat. “I don’t want you to come back!”

“What? Is that how it is?” Luzhin exclaimed, still in disbelief and totally thrown off. “But do you know, Avdotya Romanovna, that I might protest?”

“What right do you have to talk to her like that?” Pulcheria Alexandrovna interjected, heated. “And what do you even have to protest? What rights? Am I supposed to give my Dounia to a man like you? Just leave us! We messed up by agreeing to this, especially me….”

“But you’ve bound me, Pulcheria Alexandrovna,” Luzhin shouted, losing it. “By your promise! And now you’re backing out, and I’ve spent money because of that…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dounia firmly rejects Pyotr Petrovitch's advances, leading to a heated confrontation with her family.
